title: How to Make a Surprise Goodie Ice Cream Cake

steps.headline: Take out a big tin.
steps.description: Decide which ice cream you want to be the bottom layer. Using the ice cream for your bottom layer, let the ice cream sit out for about 7mins whilst the others stay in the freezer. Make sure that the ice cream doesn't completely melt but is soft enough to spread.

steps.headline: Start using the ice cream for the bottom layer and spread it across the bottom until all the bottom layer ice cream is in the tin.
steps.description: Put the tin back in the freezer until it sets. Whilst the ice cream is still freezing, make sure that you have your goodies ready. Such has little chocolates are out ready to sprinkle and so on.

steps.headline: Get the next ice cream container out so it starts softening.
steps.description: Take the tin out after it has been set. Sprinkle one of your goodies onto the top of the bottom layer. Do the middle layer just like the bottom. Let it set and get your next batch of goodies ready for the top of the middle layer.

steps.headline: Take the tin and the LAST ice cream container for the top layer and let it soften.
steps.description: Put the second one of your goodies onto the top of the middle layer.

steps.headline: Spread the top layer on top of the second goodies.
steps.description: Put it back in the freezer to let it set. Get all of your extra goodies ready (if you have some extras) and place it on the top of the ice cream cake and put it back in the freezer until serving.

text: Take out a big tin. Decide which ice cream you want to be the bottom layer. Using the ice cream for your bottom layer, let the ice cream sit out for about 7mins whilst the others stay in the freezer. Make sure that the ice cream doesn't completely melt but is soft enough to spread. Start using the ice cream for the bottom layer and spread it across the bottom until all the bottom layer ice cream is in the tin. Put the tin back in the freezer until it sets. Whilst the ice cream is still freezing, make sure that you have your goodies ready. Such has little chocolates are out ready to sprinkle and so on. Get the next ice cream container out so it starts softening. Take the tin out after it has been set. Sprinkle one of your goodies onto the top of the bottom layer. Do the middle layer just like the bottom. Let it set and get your next batch of goodies ready for the top of the middle layer. Take the tin and the LAST ice cream container for the top layer and let it soften. Put the second one of your goodies onto the top of the middle layer. Spread the top layer on top of the second goodies. Put it back in the freezer to let it set. Get all of your extra goodies ready (if you have some extras) and place it on the top of the ice cream cake and put it back in the freezer until serving. Finished.
